author: tadatek
title: Cardano Guide - A one-stop guide
description: Confused about where to begin with Cardano? This proposal provides a one-stop guide for those new to Cardano World.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea of ​​​​the proposal has identified part of the problem to be solved for this challenge, but the scale of the project's impact is so large that we can extend it to many different areas. conditions are the same around the world. The Cardano ecosystem is getting bigger and bigger over time, which is a problem for newcomers because they don't know where to start, or from which door to get in first.

The solution of this idea is good, it identifies some of the problems of the challenge, and the author of this idea argues in a logical, neat, and creative way.

The project highlights some risks in implementation, which will help the community to manage the risks if Funded, in addition, the feasibility of the idea will be better if the author comes up with a solution. to overcome those risks when it occurs.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very well, This Project provides clear and reasonable timelines for implementation and completion, relative to the information provided. This is workable, however, the goals are not specific to the information provided. the potential of the project.

The project budget required less than 20% of the total funding of this challenge, compared to the information provided by the project, all expenditures for the project were clear and explained very clearly and transparently. White.

The feasibility of this project is quite good when the human resources to implement this project have been assigned specific jobs for each item, and the experience of the members shows that it is completely suitable for the project. In addition, the members' identities are easily verified using the links listed above. The scheme is very clear, complete, and transparent.
f6_assessments.q2:
Project transparency is very good, this project provides KPIs for accomplishing project goals, all goals are easily measured by the indicators provided by the project, and they are also easily tested in an implementation.

The scheme has clearly defined success, the information from the scheme shows what is being done and how it is being done and testing has achieved considerable initial success which is amazing. With the indicators (Introduction, On-chain Analysis Off-chain, SPO, Token & NFT, Catalyst, Launchpad) the community can see the success of this project.

Brand new idea information on Cardano platform never received any funding from Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem described in this proposal is aligned with the challenge settings. Gaining trusted and valid information on a crypto ecosystem can be a nuisance. With multitude of information from trusted and unverified sources can be overwhelming for newcomers. Having an all-in-one information center can be helpful to jumpstart their journey for those who are new to the space.  With proper guidance and right information materials, it will make it easier to educate and bring onboard new members from the East Asian communities. However, the proposer did not mention on how to promote this guide to the newcomers. If I am new to crypto and looking for information on Cardano, how will I find your guide? How do you bring traffic to your website? Do you rely on search engine optimization? Having a great information center alone is not enough when people does not know that your guide exist. Please include information on how you will make your guide visible to the newcomers. Another concern is about the translation. Will this guide be in English or there will there be other languages as well such as Korean, Japan, Mongolia, Chinese etc? It will be great if the proposer can provide the information above to know the target group of the proposal. Therefore, I rate the  impact section with 4.
f6_assessments.q1:
The information about the team members are outlined clearly and are capable to execute the work. However there are 1 missing piece, as mentioned in impact section, there is a need for the guide to be visible to newcomers. Currently there are no team member assigned to handle the outreach of your guide to the masses. 
Furthermore, since the proposer and its team members are from Vietnam, will there be any translation to other languages other than English such as Korean, Mongolia, Japanese etc? Do you need to hire a professional translator to cover languages outside of your expertise?  Provide information on who will make the translation to other languages and which languages will be available on your guide. 
On the budget section, the proposing team did not elaborate on how much they are spending on language translation. Since this challenge is focusing on East Asian countries, the team needs to translate the information to East Asian countries languages such as Mongolia, Japan, Korea etc. What will be the cost to hire professional translator? Include the details for better clarification on the matter.  
Next is the execution plan. Pretty straight forward and easy to understand. Its better to include specifically which language that will be available on your website. The timeframe provided to complete the proposal are also reasonable and realistic since they are just compiling all of the information to a single source. 
In conclusion, I neither agree nor disagree with this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer did not specify the languages that will be included in their website. On your next proposal, include the total number and what languages that will be available on your website as one of the success metrics. In addition, include the estimate amount of users that you aim to reach since the main objectives of this proposal is to guide new members and how long will it take to reach the target. In conclusion, I rate the auditability section with 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers have clearly identified a problem which is that bits of Cardano related information can be found on various channels and platforms in the ecosystem, making it difficult to quickly onboard newcomers. The objective is therefore to provide a one stop guide which will give the relevant information, from the basics to the complicated stuff, with a focus on the Asian community.  Key outcomes include increasing community engagement and involvement as well as reaching a broad spectrum of people from inside and outside of Cardano, particularly helping to onboard more members from Asian countries. The proposal will clearly add value to Cardano in the sense that it will generate more interest in Cardano and get people quickly up to speed with how they can be involved in the ecosystem and actually participate. I believe it fully addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is made up of three members with verifiable skills and experience through their social media links on LinkedIn and Telegram. Team members are active in Cardano and Catalyst circles. A roadmap has been provided for the execution of the work with tasks broken down  on a month by month basis for easy identification. A bit more information about the tasks to be undertaken will however, help in understanding the details of what will be done on this project. For instance there are a number of cost elements in the budget which are not explained in the implementation plan. An example is "Research, translation, synthesis, scripts for high-quality content". THe plan does not mention that translation and research will be carried out and at what stage this will be done. The budget is however, easy to understand and  and is actionable.

In the area of risks, proposer only identified that they would need additional resources to keep updating the guide. THey did not indicate how the resources will be generated however, it is assumed that the proposers intend to receive additional funding from Catalyst to continue the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Some of the output from this project will be verifiable from the project's website such as a completed one stop guide uploaded on the site. The number of feedbacks received from the community about the guide and number of projects that will use the documents to develop their projects is also a key metric that will be measured as part of auditabililty. These are clear and easily ascertainable online and from their reports.

f6_assessments.q0: I tend to agree that the proposal could effectively address the challenge. The proposer is trying to tackle the lack of onboarding resources for people who are new to Cardano by providing guides in the form of videos. Based on what we’re provided, the videos are going to be in Vietnamese. It means that the proposal fits with the challenge setting because it reaches new users from Vietnam specifically. Based on what I observed, there seems to be a huge spike of interest in Vietnam when it comes to Cardano because the number of proposals coming in has grown significantly this fund. Thus, I believe the timing is good for an onboarding guide to exist for the community. The reason why I didn’t give it a 5 star is because the proposal could be improved in scalability and sustainability aspects. Scalability could be increased by providing those video guides with English subtitles, so they are not only targeted for Vietnamese. I understand that it might increase the cost, but since a significant portion of the budget is allocated for video production already, the subtitle budget is easy to add. Sustainability too could be improved. Correct me if I'm wrong, but the proposer appears to intend to deploy the guide to a new website (the proposer needs to clarify whether they intend to deploy it in the same Tadatek domain or not), and while the proposer has requested a year of maintenance, the current plan is not self-sustaining (the proposer still requires funding next year to keep the guide website accessible). It is obviously not ideal for a community onboarding guide to last just a year. Therefore, I would like to see more initiative on making the site stay working. Perhaps they could bring in ads, so at the very least the website could pay for itself. Any other revenue models would be awesome, as long as they are not dependent on Catalyst funding.
f6_assessments.q1: I am inclined to agree with the current implementation plan. I have looked at their profiles, and while none of them seems to have website development experience, I find that they do have a Tadatek website up and running already (so it's either they don’t list their development skills or they outsource it). Whichever it is, there seems to be no problem with the current team members' capabilities outside of that. The budget they requested is broken down based on the number of videos they would produce and the number of hours they spent on each of them, multiplied by their rate, which is already perfect. The proposer has provided the six topics that are going to be explained in the guide, and they have relevant experience to talk about them. For example, one of the members has experience as a SPO, so it's interesting to see his personal input when it comes to sharing about SPO in the guide. The timeline they provided is reasonable; based on my calculation, on average they spent 5 hours each day working on the videos. The proposer has considered the longevity concerns around the guide and offered to regularly update the contents. However, this neat proposal could still be significantly improved by marketing their guide. The proposer has already stated that they would regularly share their results with the Cardano community, but I would argue that this is not the perfect market for their guide. Based on what I observed, the difficulty level seems to be beginner-intermediate. Which means it is not meant for people who have never heard of the word blockchain, nor is it meant for people who are well versed when it comes to POS, staking, SPOs, etc. This doesn’t mean that their approach right now is invalid; it just needs slight tweaking. Perhaps they should share their work with other non-Cardano communities because they might possess blockchain knowledge but not in the Cardano ecosystem. This is far from the only perfect solution, but I would like to hear more about how the proposer views their market segmentation.
f6_assessments.q2: The currently provided information is already sufficient for auditing. We could see their milestones within the three-month implementation. The proposer is determining this proposal’s success by the number of guides they made, the number of videos they completed, and the number of projects that were developed because of the guide. The latter part seems hard to track, though, and while the proposer does mention gathering feedback, how they do it is not well explained in the proposal. That being said, those details can be explored further, and it doesn’t make the proposal hard to monitor or measure.

f6_assessments.q0: The explanation of this proposal is very clearly described by the proposer. The purpose of making documentation about cardano step by step with 6 general sections I think very interesting. All of these things are certainly important knowledge for beginners in the cardano ecosystem. As a proposal that is in the Grow East Asia category, of course a translation for each country is needed. It would be nice if the proposer also explained about the possible translation of all these guides into all national languages of all countries in east asia. The translation will definitely help the growth and adoption of cardano in east asia.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the amount of the proposed budget is in accordance with the making of this documentation, especially coupled with the production of supporting videos. The working teams also have the capacity to carry out the project and have been described by their respective expertise and experience. It's better if the team also has paid private classes if anyone is interested in continuing to become a cardano developer, so that the program for providing cardano documentation in general can continue with financial support from the private class, or do monetizing on video documentation on youtube. Just a suggestion.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the audit process to evaluate the progress and success of the project is well explained too. Maybe it can also be added to how many backlinks are given on the documentation page that is the source of other documentation. It's also a good idea to add a github page which is a place for collaboration between teams to see the progress of this project development. And all these things can be disseminated through groups that discuss cardano, blockchain and technology in general.

f6_assessments.q0:
Every new comer to cardano or any catalyst project will always be confused from where to start? or whom to consult if any barrier occurs ,during such scenario project like this will be of great help ,where it provides clear idea to the new comers and will also help them to improve their project preplanning.
The mentioned idea will also be helpful for where new comers come across experienced people ,and they get to share the knowledge and ideas with them hence this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has already experienced people which they have proved by providing us a demo video ,and setting up a video for such team will never be a difficult one where it doesn't have much risk involved in it.
The proposer has also listed few topics which he wants to concentrate and present it to the new comers, where it will be helpful for new comers in the future as guide hence with  experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal contains main members of the team with whom proposer will be working with and they have also presented us a demo video which is great to watch, The plan has clear goal on which audience to capture and proposal has also presented which are the topics they'll be covering first.
The proposal contains detailed budget breaking idea as well as detailed timeline of the project, it has also presented proper key indicators of the project to measure the success rate of the project hence the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The Cardano guide provides step-by-step instructions on how to approach, understand, and master Cardano will remove all barriers for newcomers. The solution is described in quite a detail. All the information given is enough for us to believe that this proposal will solve the challenge. But what I am concerned about is how "The Cardano Guide" can attract people to use it. Because there is already a lot of documentation about Cardano being shared. How can people trust this to be a reliable source?
f6_assessments.q1: There is little information about the project plan to be implemented in 3 months. We need to provide more detail on how the document will be created and published. For example, what content will be directed, how the videos will be created, what platforms will the videos be posted on, and how long each video will last. Unlike the planning part, the project budget is allocated quite reasonably and in detail. Example: Research, translation, synthesis, scripts for high-quality content: 36videos*4hr/video*$54/hr = $7,776.0. Talking about the team members, basic information about them is provided. We know their names, roles, and positions they have served.
f6_assessments.q2: Indicators to measure project progress are presented by the team such as A one-stop guide public on the website, a number of videos, tutorials, a number of feedback about documents by communities, and A number of projects using documents to develop their projects. I find these metrics not enough to measure the project. It should have a more specific number of goals achieved. How many videos? What is the number of interactions and responses? How many projects will use this material? In particular, where will this information be made public so that the Cardano community can accompany the development of the project?

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal looks good in terms of identifying the problem and offering a solution to embark new people to the Cardano ecosystem in East Asia. Providing the audience with all necessary documentation videos in 1 repository site so that they can become experts in an on-going technology development of Cardano without having to run around gathering pieces of information seems to be a solution.

The 6 parts of the repository documentations and manuals as planned in the proposal also show that the team behind this proposal understands the major areas of the Cardano ecosystem and my takes here is that there should be more room for updates which will be coming from different and new areas of improvement, such as DApps, DeFi and the algorithm stable coin that soon will be the main topics of discussion in the ecosystem.

Nevertheless, what actually the main issue when we are dealing with growing the ecosystem in East Asia, is the language barrier. If the proposed project will only be a one-stop repository for videos which are mostly in English, then it would be just like making a YouTube channel without having it translated to local language. So, in this respect, the team is only going to make a repetition of what is already available on YouTube channels and does not effectively address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan is presented with a well designed time horizon where at the end of the 3rd month, the team is ready to onboard new users and to provide educational service for entrepreneurships on Cardano. I would like to ask a question here regarding the new users: If this project is going to use English as the language on the website and in every documentation and manual, where are these new users expected to come from? If this is to grow the Cardano ecosystem in East Asia, we need to be specific in terms of language being used..

Regarding the budget allocated and the set time horizon, there will be 36 videos going to be made within 3 months to cover 6 major parts of the technology of Cardano, yet the team is not conveying verifiable links to show their capabilities, nor their portfolios of previous works. The team, which consists of 3 persons, is only giving not-so-informed personal credentials with small number of Linkedin connections, an uploaded YouTube video taken from a screen recording explaining on how to install a Yoroi wallet on desktop, and a Telegram channel which by no means provide proof to any of the expertise presented in the proposal.  So, based on this analysis, I think this proposal will not be implemented successfully in terms of adding value to the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: Creating what is planned on the proposal is a thing. Measuring success and having the success auditable is another thing. So, after reading that the KPI to be audited publicly in the proposal are only the website, the number of videos, the feedback for each of the documents, and the number of projects (that) use (their) documents, I must say that this is not an adequate measurement. Of course all those numbers can easily be obtained, (I am not saying fabricated) but that is only half of the KPI needed to measure the success of this proposal. There should be more metrics to measure. The simplest thing to measure and to get audited would be the amount of new wallets activated as this is how a decentralized blockchain works.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposed problem to solve here Confused newbies don't know where to start with Cardano? This recommendation provides a one-stop guide for those new to Cardano World. The proposal demonstrated how it adds value to the Cardano ecosystem by creating a kit of free Project-Based Learning Resources with a step-by-step guide on how to approach, understand, and master Cardano will remove all barriers for newbies. The implementation measures suggested by the proponent are: Create a complete "Cardano Tutorial" complete with easy-to-assess information, a trusted source of instruction compiled from knowledge Basic to advanced will assist new entrants to fully understand and take advantage of the opportunities available in the Cardano Ecosystem so that any new member who comes into contact with Cardano can experience, love and become an expert, then directly contribute and participate in the expansion of the Cardano ecosystem. This guide will remove all the barriers and concerns for new Cardano users who don't know where to start saving time and making it easier to join new members thereby expanding the scale of the project to address future challenges. therefore I completely agree that this proposal effectively solves the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent provided detailed, clear evidence of the roles and relevant skills as well as the required experiences of each member of the project with their attached social links helping them We can learn more about each member of it. The proponent also outlined a budget that I consider reasonable to be $20,462 where it is clearly outlined, broken down into specific definable items: Research costs, translation, synthesis, scripting for high-quality content: $7,776.0, Video Production $4,968.0, Video Editing $4,536.0. The infrastructure; Domain $46, Server 24/7: $436, Manage $2700. The proponent offers a realistic timetable with a reasonable, convenient plan to get the job done in 3 months with the task The specifics of each month are planned in detail, and looking at the details, it is possible to check the progress of the project. The proponent also took the risk into account when implementing the project and put in place countermeasures for that risk, so I strongly agree that this proposal will be implemented successfully. I give 5 * With the feasibility of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proponent gave a 3-month implementation roadmap, they also identified the achievements to be achieved but I have not seen the proponent give the important milestones and time to achieve each achievement I would like the proponent to give a specific timeline for each achievement they to look at so that the progress of the project can be checked. When the project is done, it will create a comprehensive set of documents with 6 main parts to help beginners get acquainted, understand, and successfully apply this knowledge to be able to start building and developing develop projects on Cardano. Proponents give metrics to measure project success: Public one-stop guide on the website, Number of videos, tutorials, Number of community document responses, Several projects use the document to develop their project. The proponent clearly describes the problem that newcomers are confused about where to start with Cardano, and the easy-to-understand description of how to solve the problem provides a one-stop guide for those new to Cardano World. This is a brand new proposal but given the information given I agree that it provides me with enough information to gauge progress towards goals. I give 4* to the feasibility of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The recommendation is really helpful for those who are new to the Cardano network. The biggest difficulty of newcomers is lack of information and not being guided in a specific and in-depth way. It is very easy for newbies to find information on the internet in a rampant way and very likely to fall into scams that waste time and money as well as lose confidence in cryptocurrencies in general.
It is proposed to provide 6 guidelines: 
1. Introduction
2. Analytic on-chain & off-chain data
3. SPO
4. NFT + Tokens
5. Catalyst
6. Launchpad
There are very specific that every newcomer to the network needs to understand.
The challenge here is the amount of knowledge that needs to be distilled into an appropriate length of video so that the information can be easily understood and enough for newcomers to avoid rambling and unnecessary information that causes difficulty. understand
I agree with the challenges of the proposal and hope to see the product as promised soon
f6_assessments.q1:
According to Proposal will provide users with basic to advanced knowledge, including user perspective and technical expertise.
The group gave a fairly specific 3-month roadmap and detailed the goals for each month. It can be seen that most of the budget is spent on video production. I rate 5 points because according to the project's proposal, after 3 months the team needs to produce 36 videos and some additional tasks. The budget given is reasonable because the workload is quite large from content filtering and then content production
The team gives information about the members involved in the project very transparently, I have checked the information of the project team members is correct
The implementation of the project will bring a lot of benefits to the community, especially to the group of new participants. Getting information accurately and quickly is always motivating and exciting for beginners
f6_assessments.q2:
Propose a 3-month roadmap and define standards for each month
The detailed investment budget for specific purposes
This proposal allows users to measure and track project progress through:
Public one-stop guide on the website
Number of videos, tutorials
Number of community document responses
Some projects use documents to develop their projects
In addition, this Proposal makes a wish to support at least 50 members. Besides, collaborating with 1-3 projects to build their business on Cardano through mastering the knowledge in this 6 guide.
The goals are very clear and transparent, contributing to the development of the community and network
I completely agree with point 5

f6_assessments.q0: This is really a great idea. For someone to take the first steps into the Cardano ecosystem is very difficult. Recalling when I started learning about Cardano, it was really difficult; remember when I started researching the Cardano ecosystem, I had a hard time finding useful knowledge on search channels as well. Like forums. With the developer's proposal, I believe that it will be easy for everyone new to the ecosystem to access and understand, thereby helping the ecosystem to grow more and more while it helps all newcomers to Have access to official information, avoiding scams in a crypto world is still very risky.
f6_assessments.q1: With the goal given by the developer, the basic things to do are clearly stated. From the beginning to guide newcomers to learn and get in touch with the Cardano ecosystem. Then there are startups and small businesses that have many formal training materials for employees. But what I worry about is the time feasibility of the tasks; even though it is recommended to have a team of experienced people in the Cardano ecosystem, the production of 36 videos is divided into 3 phases in 3 months. It's a pretty dense period. During the first two months, the team had to produce 15 videos per month; each team video is up to 3 hours long. Along with that, in Asia, the language is mainly Chinese, so I think developers should also care about this language. Having a set of documents in this language makes it more accessible to everyone. With the things I just mentioned above, the developer should hire more experts who are knowledgeable in video editing and translation to increase the feasibility of the proposal. I believe the proposal if implemented, will contribute significantly to the development of the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: Developer audits provide clear, detailed information about the costs that the project has to pay. We can look at the website and video team to assess the fairly accurate auditability of this proposal, the reasonable payments for the website design as well as the creation of the videos. I appreciate community-driven projects with the goal of helping the ecosystem grow and popularize. The last word I wish the developer and the team can do well if the project is approved.

f6_assessments.q0: Blockchain technology is becoming more and more popular and accessible. This guide is necessary to help newcomers access mainstream information. This proposal is geared towards that. The content of the tutorial consists of 6 parts from basic to advanced. Those things can help newcomers learn, grasp, and operate. I appreciate that. The main transmission method is the video and the tutorial guide. I find the simplicity and effectiveness in conveying information to the newbies based on the document attached. From the above factors, it is shown that this proposal will address the challenge posed. So I agree with their solution
f6_assessments.q1: The team of 3 members with experience is quite suitable for their role in this project. They have experience in community administration and graphic design. Especially the team has a long time with Cardano, so they will solve the problems in the process. With that comes a clear plan. Specific and measurable goals with realistic data. The proposal will be implemented in 3 main phases corresponding to 3 months. It's a time that suits the amount of work and the number of members of the team. I appreciate the success of this project. Besides, I have additional comments. The team can built-in chatbots and question libraries to respond immediately to questions. The team can set up a bonus fund for shares that bring in new users. The benefits of this guide to the community and the Cardano ecosystem will be more than the initial fund for this proposal
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is quite enough to assess the progress and success of this proposal. With 4 indicators to check the project progress and 3 indicators to check the success of the proposal. But, I found it necessary to add a tracking indicator to better assess progress and success. That is the number of people that have been approached and this indicator can assess the viral of this guideline in a community or a certain geographical area such as a country. Along with that can be an indicator of how effective these guidelines are for newbies. For example from 1* to 5*. The team can choose 4* or 4.5* as the appropriate number

solution: Free Project-Based Learning resources with step-by-step documentation on how to approach, understand, and master Cardano will remove all barriers for newcomers.
